channel.title: [PI]Character tokens?

item.title: [PI]Character tokens?
item.dc:creator: @jSherz jSherz
item.description:
@jSherz wrote:

I posted this on your other thread that’s a duplicate of this one:

When you are saving your tokens, you have to include the spaces and equal sign in the length of the string to write. For example:

The characters of prestige, two spaces and an equals gives you: 11

Same with prestigeTokens:

prestigeTokens + space + equals + space = 17

Read full topic

item.title: [PI]Character tokens?
item.dc:creator: @RS2BullDog RS2BullDog
item.description:
@RS2BullDog wrote:

characterfile.write("prestige = ", 0, 13); characterfile.write(Integer.toString(p.prestige), 0, Integer.toString(p.prestige).length()); characterfile.newLine(); characterfile.write("prestigeTokens = ", 0, 13); characterfile.write(Integer.toString(p.prestigeTokens), 0, Integer.toString(p.prestigeTokens).length()); characterfile.newLine();

That’s wrong. What that says is (What i think it is) that there is a Prestigeg line and a Prestiege Token line on the same line. It should really be this (I think)

characterfile.write("prestige = ", 0, 13); characterfile.write(Integer.toString(p.prestige), 0, Integer.toString(p.prestige).length()); characterfile.newLine(); characterfile.write("prestigeTokens = ", 0, 14); characterfile.write(Integer.toString(p.prestigeTokens), 0, Integer.toString(p.prestigeTokens).length()); characterfile.newLine();

Read full topic

item.title: [PI]Character tokens?
item.dc:creator: @ravekitty ravekitty
item.description:
@ravekitty wrote:

[quote=“Skiire, post:6, topic:436713”][quote]
characterfile.write("prestige = ", 0, 13);
[/quote]

Take a look at that. There could be more problems, that’s just the first one I saw and I haven’t really checked the rest.[/quote]

solution: the amount of letters in the int + 3

item.title: [PI]Character tokens?
item.dc:creator: @13lack_drag 13lack drag
item.description:
@13lack_drag wrote:

Okay, so I want to add character tokens, beacause i want to add a prestige system.

} else if (token.equals("prestige")) { p.prestige = Integer.parseInt(token2); } else if (token.equals("prestigeTokens")) { p.prestigeTokens = Integer.parseInt(token2);

And

characterfile.write("prestige = ", 0, 13); characterfile.write(Integer.toString(p.prestige), 0, Integer.toString(p.prestige).length()); characterfile.newLine(); characterfile.write("prestigeTokens = ", 0, 13); characterfile.write(Integer.toString(p.prestigeTokens), 0, Integer.toString(p.prestigeTokens).length()); characterfile.newLine();

I add that to playersave.java,
and i add

to player.java

After that, i compile, no errors.
Although, when i enter game, and try to save my character, i get a whole bunch of saving errors. And when i log back on, i will have nothing on my character. Any suggestions? And yes, the code up above is listen in the order, as in they are both underneath Character Rights.

Read full topic
